topContributors.summary: sbvegan: This week, sbvegan led a significant documentation overhaul, merging seven PRs in `ethereum-optimism/docs` to refactor and restructure content. Their most impactful work included a large-scale refactoring effort (#1909) that removed over 2,800 lines and porting the `op-deployer` documentation (#1911). This activity, along with a small update to the `superchain-registry` (#1179), shows a primary focus on documentation, refactoring, and general maintenance.

maurelian: Focused on advancing new features and providing extensive code review support, contributing a remarkable 37 reviews this week. They proposed a new `SuperFaultDisputeGameV2` feature (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18565) and merged a build improvement to enforce compiler warnings in contracts (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18567). Their underlying code changes of +3839/-361 lines were concentrated in tests and configuration files.

serpixel: Focused on enhancing deployment tooling within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, merging six PRs to improve CI/CD processes and upgrade capabilities. Their most impactful work involved preparing the `op-deployer` for the `op-contracts/v5.0.0` upgrade, which included significant validation changes in PR #18586 (+395/-91 lines). This work, a mix of bug fixes and new features, was complemented by 10 code reviews, demonstrating active collaboration.
almanax-ai: Focused on code review this week, leaving 43 comments on pull requests to provide feedback to the team.

smartcontracts: Drove significant feature development and stability improvements within the Optimism repository, merging three pull requests. Their most impactful contribution was the implementation of a substantial new contract check runner (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18553), alongside enhancing SystemConfig functionality (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18547) and fixing a fuzz test failure (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18550). This work, supported by 17 code reviews, demonstrated a primary focus on bug fixes and new features, mainly affecting configuration and test files.

janjakubnanista: This week, janjakubnanista focused on enhancing the stability of the deployment tooling within `ethereum-optimism/optimism`. They merged seven pull requests, notably backporting substantial pipeline fixes to `op-deployer` v4 and v5 (#18538, #18539) and correcting error handling in the CLI (#18532). This activity, concentrated on bugfixes across configuration and test files, highlights a commitment to improving the reliability of the deployment process.

geoknee: Focused on improving the robustness of core components, merging a pull request to add test coverage for the `op-node`'s SystemConfig (#18566) and opening two new PRs to enhance its sequencing and recovery logic (#18589, #18556). They were also highly engaged across the project, conducting 20 code reviews and identifying a shutdown issue in the `op-batcher` (#17768). Their code contributions were primarily focused on bug fixes and tests.

Inphi: Focused on significant code cleanup and improving testing infrastructure, driving a large-scale refactor that removed over 7,100 lines of code. They merged a pull request to enhance CI by generating XML test results (#18579) and opened another to remove feature flags (#18588). In addition to these contributions, Inphi was highly engaged in collaboration, providing 16 code reviews for the team.

scharissis: Focused on improving the stability and efficiency of the CI and testing infrastructure, merging six pull requests across the `optimism` and `infra` repositories. Key contributions include resolving a subtest logging memory leak in `op-acceptor` (infra#526) and implementing CI caching and retries (optimism#18572), which added 147 lines of new functionality. This work primarily involved bug fixes and test enhancements, with a heavy concentration on modifying configuration and test files.

theochap: Focused on system maintenance and issue identification, opening three pull requests to upstream `op-rs/kona` (#18561, #18568, #18569). They also created a new issue to address p2p connection flakiness (#18570) and supported the team by providing 5 reviews across other pull requests.

agusduha: Focused on fixing missing commits in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, merging a significant fix for missing CGT commits in PR #18560 (+405/-183 lines). They continued this effort with two additional open PRs and supported the team with two approvals and three PR comments. This work, split between feature and other tasks, consisted primarily of changes to test files.

Wazabie: Focused on the Soneium testnet, delivering a key feature to enable permissionless functionality via PR ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops#1317. In addition to this impactful work, they supported the team by reviewing 6 pull requests. Their code contributions show a focus across tests, documentation, and configuration files.

teddyknox: Made a significant contribution to the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository by adding kona, rollup-boost, and op-rbuilder as submodules for acceptance testing via PR #18540. This substantial change involved over 1200 lines of new code and was supplemented by 11 review comments on other PRs. Their work this week was primarily focused on testing and other related code.

aliersh: Focused on improving the reliability of the testing and CI infrastructure this week. They merged a significant fix to the AI contract tests to prevent race conditions by adding no-changes tracking (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18601, +539/-191 lines), and also improved CI support for external pull requests (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18557). This activity reflects a primary focus on bug fixes and enhancements within the project's test suite.

opgitgovernance: Performed routine maintenance by merging three automated codegen updates in the `ethereum-optimism/superchain-registry` repository (#1177, #1178, #1180). They also engaged in discussions, leaving 11 comments on pull requests. This activity consisted of minor updates, primarily touching configuration files.

0xDiscotech: Focused on preparing new production configurations, advancing a significant feature in `ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops` via PR #1318 which introduced substantial changes (+13745/-3838 lines). Alongside this work, they supported the team by conducting 4 code reviews. Their contributions were heavily concentrated in tests (69%) and documentation (15%), indicating a strong focus on ensuring the stability of the new configurations.

pauldowman: Focused on release coordination and system configuration, merging a pull request to add new prestates to the superchain registry (ethereum-optimism/superchain-registry#1176). They planned for future network updates by creating tracking issues for the U17 and U18 releases (#17982, #18548) and began work to improve vm-runner stability in an open PR (#18594). Additionally, they provided feedback across five other pull requests.

stevennevins: Focused on bug fixes and feature development, making substantial code changes (+2379/-1117 lines) across 36 commits this week. This work led to an open feature PR in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#18559) to add L2 chain ID lookup functionality. They also actively supported the team by providing 8 code reviews, with their contributions primarily touching bug fixes, configuration, and tests.

0xiamflux: Focused on enabling chain upgrades within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository by adding OPCM v2 support to the op-deployer. They advanced this significant new feature through a work-in-progress pull request (#18593), which introduced substantial changes (+9629/-1732 lines), and also opened a related issue (#18536) to track requirements. This effort was supported by collaborative engagement through 4 code reviews and a balanced focus on feature implementation and extensive testing.

pcw109550: Focused on the Optimism node, merging a significant refactor in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#18571) to ensure the Light CL consistently follows its source. This work, which involved 45 commits and a large reduction in code (+380/-839 lines), was primarily focused on core logic and associated tests. In addition, they contributed two reviews with comments on other pull requests.

devin-ai-integration: Focused on test maintenance in the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository, opening six pull requests aimed at skipping specific tests (e.g., #18595, #18600). They also engaged in pull request discussions, leaving seven comments.

AmadiMichael: Focused on advancing the "verify opcm v2" pull request (`ethereum-optimism/optimism#18590`), pushing significant changes (+1138/-2404) across 88 files. In addition to this development work, they supported the team by conducting 4 code reviews. Their commits indicate a focus on bug fixes, with notable changes to configuration and test files.
joshklop: Focused on code review this week, providing feedback across 9 pull request reviews and adding one additional PR comment.

axelKingsley: Focused on improving system specifications, merging a clarification for how malformed updates are handled in `ethereum-optimism/specs#868`. They also identified a potential issue for evaluation regarding transaction interoperability in `ethereum-optimism/optimism#18574` and supported the team with 3 code reviews. Their code contributions this week were concentrated in tests.

tremarkley: Focused on repository maintenance this week, merging a fix to update `CODEOWNERS` in `ethereum-optimism/infra#529`. They also supported the team by reviewing 3 pull requests and leaving a comment.

nonsense: This week, their work focused on improving testing infrastructure and development processes, merging a fix in the batcher acceptance tests to handle pending nonces (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18564). They also initiated an effort to formalize the release process by creating an issue for it (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18592) and provided feedback on 2 other pull requests. Based on their contributions, their primary focus was on tests and other related work.

antonkeen: This week, antonkeen's work involved data maintenance in the ethereum-optimism/ethereum-optimism.github.io repository. They merged one pull request (#1246) to update the circulatingSupply.txt file.
bitwiseguy: Focused on supporting the team this week, providing feedback and unblocking others by reviewing and approving 7 pull requests.

0xniha: Made substantial progress on local development, authoring significant changes (+1444/-167 lines) across 55 files. In addition to this coding effort, they supported the team by providing 7 review comments on active pull requests. Their work indicates a balanced focus on both new feature development and bug fixes.

Himess: Focused on code simplification within the batcher component, opening a pull request to remove the `isPectra` feature flag (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18534). This proposed change modifies 8 files, resulting in a net code reduction (+41/-84 lines) across both application logic and tests. Himess also contributed to one discussion by commenting on an issue.

MSilb7: Focused on data corrections in the `op-analytics` repository this week, merging a single pull request to address an issue with the circulating supply calculation (ethereum-optimism/op-analytics#1773). This contribution involved a notable change of +333/-331 lines across four files. The work was an even mix of bug fixing and refactoring.

0xmad: Focused on preparing documentation for the OP Stack launch, opening a feature pull request in `ethereum-optimism/docs` (#1915). This work involved changes to documentation and configuration files.

opsuperchain: Focused on implementing core filtering logic, opening a significant pull request in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#18603). This contribution, classified as bugfix work, added over 1430 lines of new code and tests.

jsvisa: Focused on improving the documentation within the `ethereum-optimism/docs` repository, merging two feature PRs. Their most significant contribution was splitting the JSON-RPC documentation into Geth and node-specific sections in PR #1905 (+786/-119 lines), and they also disabled p2p by default for the devnet in PR #1906. This week's activity shows a primary focus on documentation and configuration file changes.
mds1: Focused on supporting the team through code review this week, providing 5 approvals to help advance teammates' work.
falcorocks: Focused on supporting the team through code review this week, providing 5 approvals on pull requests.

sebastianst: Focused on planning a significant architectural migration within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this week. They created key tracking issues to migrate the `kona` and `op-reth` crates into the monorepo (#18575, #18576, #18577). Alongside this planning, they supported the team's work by conducting 5 code reviews.

robert-e-davidson3: Focused on enhancing data availability resilience in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this week. They opened a significant pull request (#18602) to implement a feature that falls back to L1 if AltDA fails. This work, consisting of +490 lines of new code and tests, represents a focused effort on new feature development.

dRPCMarketing: This week's contribution was a documentation update in the ethereum-optimism/docs repository. They merged PR #1908 to update the dRPC entry. Their work was focused entirely on documentation.
ccerv1: This week, ccerv1's activity was focused on documentation maintenance. They merged one pull request in ethereum-optimism/Retro-Funding (#90) to update the project's changelog.
wiz-inc-a178a98b5d: Focused on collaboration this week, providing feedback on pull requests through 4 reviews and 8 comments.
yashvardhan-kukreja: Focused on supporting the team through code review this week, providing feedback across 4 pull requests which included one approval.

tuxcanfly: Focused on enhancing data handling capabilities within the `op-batcher`, opening a pull request in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#18552) to allow for configurable multiple frames per transaction.

karlfloersch: Focused on bug fixes this week, committing substantial code changes (+835/-39 lines across 29 files). They also contributed through code review, providing 3 reviews with one approval. The primary focus of their coding activity was bugfix work.
hexshire: Focused on test-related work this week, pushing 2 commits that modified 6 files (+126/-38 lines). They also contributed to peer review, leaving comments on 3 pull requests.

op-will: Focused on system architecture this week, proposing a simplification for the kona-node actor design. This work was captured in a single open pull request (ethereum-optimism/design-docs#358), which added 219 lines to a design document.

jurajpiar: Initiated new work in the ethereum-optimism ecosystem, opening two pull requests in `ethereum-optimism/op-geth` (#733) and `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#18573). This foundational effort involved 5 commits modifying 76 files (+984/-987 lines).

googgoog: Work this week centered on an optimization for the `op-proposer` in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They opened a pull request (#18587) which aims to improve efficiency by avoiding unnecessary `claimData` calls for non-matching game types.

its-everdred: Focused on improving data validation by adding a new circulating supply test in `ethereum-optimism/ethereum-optimism.github.io` via PR #1247. In addition to this merged work, they also supported the team by reviewing and approving one pull request. Their contributions this week were concentrated entirely on enhancing test coverage.

kustrun: Focused on a bugfix for the Optimism client this week. They opened a pull request (ethereum-optimism/op-geth#732) to address an issue with the `eth_simulateV1` method that appeared after the Jovian fork.

operagxsasha: Focused on improving the build process in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, opening a pull request (#18541) to fix an issue with FFI builds. This contribution involved a minor change to a configuration file.
Snezhkko: This week, Snezhkko's work focused on code cleanup within the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository. They opened a pull request (#18582) to remove a dead field from the op-conductor.
mikhaildobs: Contributed to project documentation by opening a pull request to add a new faucet link for developers (ethereum-optimism/docs#1917).

findfluctuate: This week's activity was focused on improving documentation, opening a pull request in `ethereum-optimism/infra#531` to fix comments for better readability. This involved a single-line change in a documentation file.

Galoretka: Focused on improving node stability by opening a pull request to handle a missing cancel hook in the critical error handler (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18535). This work represents a targeted bugfix to improve system robustness.
tynes: Activity was light this week, consisting of one pull request approval.
